param.name: Active
param.desc: True to activate task, false otherwise

param.name: Default altitude
param.desc: Altitude to be used if desired Z has no units

param.name: Default speed
param.desc: Speed to be used if desired speed is not specified

param.name: Power Module
param.desc: There is a Power Module installed

param.name: Seconds before Waypoint
param.desc: Seconds before actually reaching Waypoint that it is considered as reached

param.name: Loitering Radius
param.desc: Radius of loitering circle after arriving at destination

param.name: Default Speed
param.desc: Speed to use in case no speed is given by reference source.

param.name: Default Speed Units
param.desc: Units to use for default speed (one of 'm/s', 'rpm' or '%').

param.name: Default Z
param.desc: Default z when no vertical reference is given.

param.name: Default Z Units
param.desc: Units to use for default z reference ('DEPTH', 'ALTITUDE' or 'HEIGHT')

param.name: Minimum Radius
param.desc: Minimum radius to prevent incompatibility with path controller

param.name: Execution Frequency
param.desc: Frequency at which task is executed

param.name: CPU - Moving Average Samples
param.desc: Number of moving average samples to smooth CPU usage

param.name: CPU - Maximum Usage
param.desc: Maximum CPU usage. When this value is hit an error will be raised

param.name: Minimum GPS Fixes
param.desc: Minimum number of GPS fixes required to compute the clock offset

param.name: Maximum Clock Offset
param.desc: Maximum Clock Offset. If the clock offset is above this value the clock will be syncronized

param.name: Boot Synchronization Timeout
param.desc: At boot the system tries to synchronize clocks. It continues unsynched after timeout

param.name: Hardware Clock Synchronization Command
param.desc: System command to execute everytime the clock is synchronized

param.name: Report Timeout
param.desc: Timeout threshold to report Entity error

param.name: Default Monitoring -- Hardware
param.desc: Additional default entities to monitor in Hardware profile

param.name: Maximum Consecutive Transitions
param.desc: Maximum number of consecutive transitions before starting to ignore

param.name: Compute Progress
param.desc: True if plan progress should be computed

param.name: RPM Conversion Factor
param.desc: Factor to convert from RPMs to meters per second

param.name: Actuation Conversion Factor
param.desc: Factor to convert from actuation to meters per second

param.name: Abort On Failed Activation
param.desc: Abort when a payload fails to activate

param.name: Dive depth
param.desc: Depth to dive in response to 'dive' command

param.name: Traveling depth
param.desc: Depth to use when traveling (Goto maneuvers)

param.name: Dive seconds
param.desc: Time to be under water in response to 'dive' command (seconds)

param.name: Loiter radius
param.desc: Radius of generated loiter and station keeping maneuvers

param.name: RPM Speed
param.desc: Speed in RPMs to be used in the generated maneuvers

param.name: Execution Frequency
param.desc: Frequency at which task is executed

param.name: Lost Comms Plan
param.desc: Plan to be executed in case of Lost Communications

param.name: Execution Frequency
param.desc: Frequency at which task is executed

param.name: Safe Entities
param.desc: Relevant entities when performing a safe plan

param.name: Ignored Interfaces
param.desc: List of interfaces whose services will not be announced

param.name: Loading Order
param.desc: List of messages ordered by loading order

param.name: Transports
param.default: Voltage, Current, FuelLevel, GpsFix, EntityState, CpuUsage, StorageUsage, Heartbeat, Temperature, RSSI, LinkLevel

param.name: Flush Interval
param.desc: Number of second to wait before forcing data to be written to disk

param.name: Transports
param.default: Acceleration, AngularVelocity, ControlLoops, CpuUsage, Current, DesiredHeading, DesiredPath, DesiredRoll, DesiredSpeed, DesiredVerticalRate, DesiredZ, EntityList, EntityState, EstimatedState, EstimatedStreamVelocity, FollowReference, FollowRefState, GpsFix, IndicatedSpeed, LinkLevel, LogBookEntry, ManeuverControlState, PathControlState, PlanControl, PlanSpecification, PlanControlState, Pressure, Reference, Rpm, RSSI, SetControlSurfaceDeflection, SetThrusterActuation, StopManeuver, Temperature, TrueSpeed, TrexObservation, TrexPlan, TrexToken, VehicleCommand, VehicleState, Voltage

param.name: Serial Port - Device
param.desc: Serial port device used to communicate with the sensor

param.name: Local Port
param.desc: Local UDP port to listen on

param.name: Static Destinations
param.desc: List of <IPv4>:<Port> destinations that will always receive outgoing messages

param.name: Announce Service
param.desc: Announce this transport to services or not

param.name: Underwater Communications
param.desc: Allow underwater communication when limited comms are being simulated

param.name: Transports
param.default: CpuUsage, Current, DesiredRoll, DesiredPath, DesiredZ, EntityList, EntityState, EstimatedState, EstimatedStreamVelocity, FollowRefState, GpsFix, Heartbeat, IndicatedSpeed, LogBookControl, LoggingControl, PathControlState, PlanControl, PlanControlState, PlanDB, PlanGeneration, QueryEntityParameters, SaveEntityParameters, SetEntityParameters, Target, Temperature, TrexOperation, TrueSpeed, VehicleState, Voltage

param.name: Always Transmitted Messages
param.desc: List of messages that will always be transmitted disregarding communication limitations

param.name: Local Port
param.desc: Local UDP port to listen on

param.name: Static Destinations
param.desc: List of <IPv4>:<Port> destinations that will always receive outgoing messages

param.name: Announce Service
param.desc: Announce this transport to services or not

param.name: Underwater Communications
param.desc: Allow underwater communication when limited comms are being simulated

param.name: Transports
param.default: Abort, EntityList, EstimatedState, GpsFix, FollowRefState, TrexOperation, PlanControlState, OperationalLimits, NavigationUncertainty, VehicleMedium

param.desc: List of messages that will always be transmitted disregarding communication limitations
